# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Data

wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines")

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width=10)
    wrapped_text = ""
    
    for word in split(text, " ")
        # Check if the current line would exceed the width
        if length(wrapped_text) * text_width + length(word) > text_width
            # Add a new line and start the next word on the next line
            wrapped_text *= "\n"
        wrapped_text *= word
    end
    
    return wrapped_text
end

# Example
text = "This function will wrap words into lines"
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)
println(wrapped_text)
```
This code defines a `wrap_string` function that wraps words in a given text to a maximum width. The example provided demonstrates how to use this function with the given text.
